intro: Batrachium heterophyllum var. peltatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved batrachium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on long, slender pedicels. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
